text.text_translated: In the last 200 years, better technology and health meant fewer children died. So, families had many children. These children lived and grew up and had their own children. This made the number of people grow very fast. But in the 1960s, many people could get contraception. Contraception is a way to stop having babies. So, around the world, women had fewer babies. The number of babies for each woman went from six to two.

best_attempt.text_translated: In the last 200 years, new machines and better health meant fewer children died. Because fewer children died, families became big. These big families had even more children. This made the number of people grow very fast. But in the 1960s, many people could get contraception. Contraception stops a woman from having a baby. So, women in the world had fewer babies. Before, a woman had six babies. Now, a woman has only two babies.
